title: String Concatenation
description:
Practice combining strings using different methods. This exercise focuses on returning combined strings, not printing them.

Steps:
1. Implement `combine_words` so `combine_words('Hello', 'World')` returns "Hello World"; `combine_words('Ruby', 'programming')` returns "Ruby programming".
2. Implement `full_name` so `full_name('John', 'Doe')` returns "John Doe"; `full_name('Alice', 'Smith')` returns "Alice Smith".
3. Implement `greeting` so `greeting('Alice')` returns "Hello, Alice! Welcome!"; `greeting('Bob')` returns "Hello, Bob! Welcome!".

Expected results:
- `combine_words('Hello', 'World')` returns "Hello World"
- `combine_words('Ruby', 'programming')` returns "Ruby programming"
- `full_name('John', 'Doe')` returns "John Doe"
- `full_name('Alice', 'Smith')` returns "Alice Smith"
- `greeting('Alice')` returns "Hello, Alice! Welcome!"
- `greeting('Bob')` returns "Hello, Bob! Welcome!"
